agents.name: GitHub Issue to Slack Hub
agents.description: Receives new GitHub issue details and sends a formatted message to Slack.
agents.instructions:
## üßë‚Äçüíº Role:
You are the assistant responsible for sending new GitHub issue details to Slack.

---
## ‚öôÔ∏è Steps to Follow:
1. Receive a new GitHub issue payload (via trigger).
2. Extract the relevant details: issue title, description, URL, creator, and any labels.
3. Format a Slack message summarizing the issue (include all details and a direct link).
4. Use [@tool:Send message](#mention) to post the message to the specified Slack channel.
5. Respond with 'done!' to indicate completion.

---
## üéØ Scope:
‚úÖ In Scope:
- Formatting and sending Slack messages for new GitHub issues.

‚ùå Out of Scope:
- Handling other GitHub events.

---
## üìã Guidelines:
‚úîÔ∏è Dos:
- Ensure the message is clear and includes all relevant details.
- Use markdown formatting for readability.

üö´ Don'ts:
- Do not process non-issue events.
- CRITICAL: Only call the Slack tool once per issue event.

# Examples
- **Trigger** : New GitHub issue: 'Bug: Login fails', description: 'User cannot log in', url: 'https://github.com/org/repo/issues/123', creator: 'alice', labels: ['bug']
 - **Agent actions**: Call [@tool:Send message](#mention)
 - **Agent response**: done!

tools.name: Send message
tools.description: Posts a message to a slack channel, direct message, or private group; requires content via `text`, `blocks`, or `attachments`.

as_user.description: Post as the authenticated user instead of as a bot. Defaults to `false`. If `true`, `username`, `icon_emoji`, and `icon_url` are ignored. If `false`, the message is posted as a bot, allowing appearance customization.

attachments.description: URL-encoded JSON array of message attachments, a legacy method for rich content. See Slack API documentation for structure.

blocks.description: DEPRECATED: Use `markdown_text` field instead. URL-encoded JSON array of layout blocks for rich/interactive messages. See Slack API Block Kit docs for structure.

channel.description: ID or name of the channel, private group, or IM channel to send the message to.

icon_emoji.description: Emoji for bot's icon (e.g., ':robot_face:'). Overrides `icon_url`. Applies if `as_user` is `false`.

icon_url.description: Image URL for bot's icon (must be HTTPS). Applies if `as_user` is `false`.

link_names.description: Automatically hyperlink channel names (e.g., #channel) and usernames (e.g., @user) in message text. Defaults to `false` for bot messages.

markdown_text.description: PREFERRED: Write your message in markdown for nicely formatted display. Supports: headers (# ## ###), bold (**text** or __text__), italic (*text* or _text_), strikethrough (~~text~~), inline code (`code`), code blocks (```), links ([text](url)), block quotes (>), lists (- item, 1. item), dividers (--- or ***), context blocks (:::context with images), and section buttons (:::section-button). IMPORTANT: Use \\n for line breaks (e.g., 'Line 1\\nLine 2'), not actual newlines. USER MENTIONS: To tag users, use their user ID with <@USER_ID> format (e.g., <@U1234567890>), not username.

mrkdwn.description: Disable Slack's markdown for `text` field if `false`. Default `true` (allows *bold*, _italic_, etc.).

parse.description: Message text parsing behavior. Default `none` (no special parsing). `full` parses as user-typed (links @mentions, #channels). See Slack API docs for details.

reply_broadcast.description: If `true` for a threaded reply, also posts to main channel. Defaults to `false`.

text.description: DEPRECATED: This sends raw text only, use markdown_text field. Primary textual content. Recommended fallback if using `blocks` or `attachments`. Supports mrkdwn unless `mrkdwn` is `false`.

thread_ts.description: Timestamp (`ts`) of an existing message to make this a threaded reply. Use `ts` of the parent message, not another reply. Example: '1476746824.000004'.

unfurl_links.description: Enable unfurling of text-based URLs. Defaults `false` for bots, `true` if `as_user` is `true`.

unfurl_media.description: Disable unfurling of media content from URLs if `false`. Defaults to `true`.

username.description: Bot's name in Slack (max 80 chars). Applies if `as_user` is `false`.
